intro: Duguetia venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan duguetia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
